hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Asymmetry
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of low volatility (BTC 20-day realized volatility < 30%) within a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band will lead to a more sustained and higher magnitude move than a breakdown below the lower band, due to asymmetric liquidity and positioning.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes with suppressed volatility, markets are often coiled. A breakout to the upside tends to trigger FOMO and short covering in a low-yield macro environment, while breakdowns face immediate dip-buying from institutional and long-term holders, making them less reliable.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Realized Volatility < 30% for at least 10 consecutive days
BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band (2 std) upper band OR below lower band

exit_conditions.take_profit: For long entry: 5 ATR (20-day) move from entry. For short entry: 3 ATR (20-day) move from entry.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average return magnitude (absolute) for short signals (breakdowns) is statistically greater than or equal to that of long signals (breakouts) over a 5-day horizon, across 20+ instances.
